intro: Oxydectes lachnocarpa, commonly known as the sticky seed tree, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, sticky seeds that adhere to the fur of animals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The species is notable for its ecological role in seed dispersal due to the unique adhesive properties of its seeds.
